title: Acts of the dispute and conference holden at Paris, in the moneths of Iuly and August. 1566. Betweene two doctors of Sorbon, and two ministers of the Reformed Church A most excellent tract, wherein the learned may take pleasure, and the ignorant reape knowledge. Translated out of French by Iohn Golburne, and diuided according to the daies.
author: Golburne, John.
notes: A translation of: Actes de la dispute & conference tenue Ã  Paris.
The disputants, named in the preface, were Simon Vigor and Claude de Sainctes of the Sorbonne, and Hugues Sureau Du Rosier and Jean de L'Espine of the Reformed Church.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A.".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
